result.execSummary:
The defendant Israel Rey Vasquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $500 has been applied. Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the Fine/Costs.

records.addlTxt: Order for Reassignment of Cases from Judge Dutcher to Judge Blader signed by Chief Judge Dutcher on 8/1/2022 filed in 2022GF27.

Case called 3:00 PM Defendant Israel Rey Vasquez in court.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Israel Rey Vasquez. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 3 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Count 2 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: Ct 1- $150 fine plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Ct 3 - Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.

Case called @ 01:14 PM Defendant Israel Rey Vasquez in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Emma K Blankschein.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant is eligible for SPD services. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 09:25 am.
